description: Students read and discuss children's literature from Britain and the United States. Beginning with fairy tales and classics from the "golden age" of children's literature, students explore an array of picture books, poetry, and fiction, that exemplifies the best in fantasy and realism for children and young adults. Offered annually. Also counts toward gender and sexuality studies major and educational studies and gender and sexuality studies concentrations. Prerequisite: WRIT 120 or equivalent.
name: Children's & Young Adult Literature
title: Children's and Young Adult Literature
